content.raw: fixed
removed
yes by default but one can specify the sdf parameter `<imuLinkName>` to override it.
content.html: yes by default but one can specify the sdf parameter <imuLinkName> to override it.

content.raw: 2-space indentation
Do we need these comments?
So this is meant to be used only with the iris, right? The name is hardcoded here.
content.html: So this is meant to be used only with the iris, right? The name is hardcoded here.

content.raw: std::thread?
Use std mutex?
Can we use `std::bind` here?
Can we use ignition math?

Just a suggestion, I don't think `[ArduCopterPlugin]` is necessary with `gzwarn` and `gzerr`, because they already print the origin file and line, i.e.:

`[Err] [ArduCopterPlugin.cc:94] [ArduCopterPlugin] Please specify a jointName, where the rotor is attached.`
content.html:
Just a suggestion, I don't think [ArduCopterPlugin] is necessary with gzwarn and gzerr, because they already print the origin file and line, i.e.:

[Err] [ArduCopterPlugin.cc:94] [ArduCopterPlugin] Please specify a jointName, where the rotor is attached.

content.raw: It would be cool to have a tutorial on how to use this :smile:
content.html: It would be cool to have a tutorial on how to use this

content.raw: And for other new files too :)

update.description:
* need [this pull request from gazebo_models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff)
* redo pull request #2010 without the `keyhit` detector containing LGPL code
* Need [this pull request for models](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/pull-requests/177/aerodynamics-models/diff).
* Adding a world file with the Cessna model and the liftDrag plugin. Controlled cessna flight by adding lift drag plugin response to control surface joint (cl only for now)
* change drag and re-orient sensor data before sending out to SIM_Gazebo
* use actual rotor speed by reducing rotorVelocitySlowdownSim from 10 to 1, and got rid of vertical and yaw coupling by adjusting cla and cda.
* [video](https://youtu.be/n_M5Vs5FBGY)
update.title: Aerodynamic updates

content.raw: Thanks for the info. A later pull request should be fine.
content.html: Thanks for the info. A later pull request should be fine.

content.raw: should be fixed
